docblock.description: handle_error() callback function for handling trigger_error() errors

tag.name: param
tag.description: contains the level of the error raised, as an integer.

tag.name: param
tag.description: contains the error message, as a string.

tag.name: param
tag.description: contains the filename that the error was raised in, as a string.

tag.name: param
tag.description: contains the line number the error was raised at, as an integer.

tag.name: param
tag.description: an array that points to the active symbol table at the point the error occurred. In other words, errcontext will contain an array of every variable that existed in the scope the error was triggered in. User error handler must not modify error context.

docblock.description: model_rwd::get_instance($arg) Gets an instance that represent the row from the table $arg can either be the primary key or the field value of the field related to the variable type examples: member::get_instance(1); // gets the member::TABLE row with primary key 1 admin::get_instance(123); member::get_instance('albert@add.ph');

docblock.description: smart_field_query($query,$field,$threshold=0.5,$allowed_difference=0.25) Queries for $field that looks like $query This function has the ability to query for a field value even though it is misspelled For very big tables, this might cause CPU spikes
